remarks: The value of isomorphism H at the lattice zero is the singleton of the zero vector i.e. the zero subspace.  (Contributed by NM, 9-Mar-2014.)
statement:
dih0.z $e |- .0. = ( 0. ` K ) $.
dih0.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dih0.i $e |- I = ( ( DIsoH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dih0.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dih0.o $e |- O = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dih0 $p |- ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) -> ( I ` .0. ) = { O } ) $.
